insertbefore.description: Used with C(state=present). If specified, the variable will be inserted just before the variable specified.

cron_file.description: If specified, uses this file instead of an individual user's crontab. Without a leading /, this is assumed to be in /etc/cron.d.  With a leading /, this is taken as absolute.

value.description: The value to set this variable to.  Required if state=present.

state.description: Whether to ensure that the variable is present or absent.

user.description: The specific user whose crontab should be modified.

insertafter.description: Used with C(state=present). If specified, the variable will be inserted after the variable specified.

backup.description: If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup) variable by this module.
